verses.text_plain: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
verses.verse_html: 1Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

verses.text_plain: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?
verses.verse_html:
2Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself? ▼
▼ as he…: or, if he may be profitable, doth his good success depend thereon?

footnotes.body_text: ▼ as he…: or, if he may be profitable, doth his good success depend thereon?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ as he…: or, if he may be profitable, doth his good success depend thereon?

verses.text_plain: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
verses.verse_html: 3Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

verses.text_plain: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?
verses.verse_html: 4Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?

verses.text_plain: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?
verses.verse_html: 5Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?

verses.text_plain: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.
verses.verse_html:
6For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing. ▼
▼ the naked…: Heb. the clothes of the naked

tokens.text: For thou hast taken a pledge

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the naked…: Heb. the clothes of the naked
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the naked…: Heb. the clothes of the naked

verses.text_plain: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
verses.verse_html: 7Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

verses.text_plain: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.
verses.verse_html:
8But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it. ▼
▼ mighty…: Heb. man of arm
 , ▼
▼ honourable…: Heb. eminent, or, accepted for countenance

footnotes.body_html: ▼ mighty…: Heb. man of arm

footnotes.body_text: ▼ honourable…: Heb. eminent, or, accepted for countenance
footnotes.body_html: ▼ honourable…: Heb. eminent, or, accepted for countenance

verses.text_plain: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
verses.verse_html: 9Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

verses.text_plain: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;
verses.verse_html: 10Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;

verses.text_plain: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.
verses.verse_html: 11Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.

verses.text_plain: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
verses.verse_html:
12Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are! ▼
▼ height of the stars: Heb. head of the stars

footnotes.body_text: ▼ height of the stars: Heb. head of the stars
footnotes.body_html: ▼ height of the stars: Heb. head of the stars

verses.text_plain: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?
verses.verse_html:
13And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud? ▼
▼ How: or, What

verses.text_plain: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.
verses.verse_html: 14Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

verses.text_plain: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?
verses.verse_html: 15Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?

verses.text_plain: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:
verses.verse_html:
16Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood: ▼
▼ whose…: Heb. a flood was poured upon their foundation

footnotes.body_text: ▼ whose…: Heb. a flood was poured upon their foundation
footnotes.body_html: ▼ whose…: Heb. a flood was poured upon their foundation

verses.text_plain: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?
verses.verse_html:
17Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them? ▼
▼ for: or, to

tokens.text: from us: and what can the Almighty

verses.text_plain: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
verses.verse_html: 18Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

verses.text_plain: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.
verses.verse_html: 19The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.

verses.text_plain: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.
verses.verse_html:
20Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth. ▼
▼ substance: or, estate
 , ▼
▼ the remnant…: or, their excellency

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the remnant…: or, their excellency

verses.text_plain: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
verses.verse_html:
21Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee. ▼
▼ him: that is, God

tokens.text: now thyself with him, and be at peace

footnotes.body_html: ▼ him: that is, God

verses.text_plain: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.
verses.verse_html: 22Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.

verses.text_plain: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
verses.verse_html: 23If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

verses.text_plain: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.
verses.verse_html:
24Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks. ▼
▼ as dust: or, on the dust

footnotes.body_text: ▼ as dust: or, on the dust
footnotes.body_html: ▼ as dust: or, on the dust

verses.text_plain: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.
verses.verse_html:
25Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver. ▼
▼ defence: or, gold
 , ▼
▼ plenty…: Heb. silver of strength

footnotes.body_html: ▼ plenty…: Heb. silver of strength

verses.text_plain: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
verses.verse_html: 26For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

tokens.text: For then shalt thou have thy delight

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.
verses.verse_html: 27Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.

tokens.text: unto him, and he shall hear

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
verses.verse_html: 28Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.

verses.text_plain: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.
verses.verse_html:
29When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person. ▼
▼ the humble…: Heb. him that hath low eyes

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the humble…: Heb. him that hath low eyes
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the humble…: Heb. him that hath low eyes

verses.text_plain: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
verses.verse_html:
30He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands. ▼
▼ He shall…: or, The innocent shall deliver the island

footnotes.body_text: ▼ He shall…: or, The innocent shall deliver the island
footnotes.body_html: ▼ He shall…: or, The innocent shall deliver the island
